bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to W. Edwin Hemphill, November 6, 1951

div1.p: Hench sends two photographs to Hemphill, for use in an article by the Virginia State Library. He hopes to receive some copies of the article when it is printed, so that they can be distributed among Reed family members and friends.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to W. Edwin Hemphill, November 6, 1951
div1.opener:
Via Air Mail
November 6, 1951
Dr. W. Edwin Hemphill
Head, History Division
Virginia State Library
Richmond 19, Virginia
My dear Doctor Hemphill:
div1.p:
I am enclosing the photographs you requested: an 8 by 10 glossy
photograph of the medical diploma of Walter Reed from the University
of Virginia and two photographs each, one about 3 by 5 and the
other about 8 by 10, of Walter Reed's house before and after it
was made over.

The latter views of Walter Reed's birthplace appear to be copied
from post cards which I think General Keane or the Reed family
gave me. Whether or not they are copyrighted, I do not know.
They don't seem to be. At least there is no notation on the card.
The diploma is in my actual possession. I hope the photograph
is satisfactory, but if not, we can have it rephotographed. Please
use the credit line for the diploma thus: “The Reed family through
Dr. P. S. Hench.”

I will appreciate it greatly if you will send me three or four
copies of the article when it is printed. I should like to send
them to old friends of Walter Reed. I assume that you will send a
copy to Walter Reed's son and to his daughter. If you wish me to
send them, I will do so.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:bt
